class pybullet_ros.pybullet_ros_wrapper.pyBulletRosWrapper

Bases: Node

ROS wrapper class for pybullet simulator

get_properties()

construct 3 dictionaries: - joint index to joint name x2 (1 for revolute, 1 for fixed joints) - link name to link index dictionary

Returns

tuple containing 3 dictionaries

Return type

tuple

handle_pause_physics(req: Empty_Request, resp: Empty_Response)

pause simulation, raise flag to prevent pybullet to execute self.pb.stepSimulation()

Parameters

  • req (Empty.Request) – an empty data structure

  • resp (Empty.Response) – an empty data structure representing response to the client

Raises

flag – _description_

Returns

an empty data structure representing response to the client

Return type

Empty.Response

handle_reset_simulation(req: Empty_Request, resp: Empty_Response)

Callback to handle the service offered by this node to reset the simulation

Parameters

  • req (Empty.Request) – an empty data structure repreenting request by the client

  • resp (Empty.Response) – an empty data structure representing response to the client

Returns

an empty data structure representing response to the client

Return type

Empty.Response

handle_unpause_physics(req: Empty_Request, resp: Empty_Response)

unpause simulation, lower flag to allow pybullet to execute self.pb.stepSimulation()

Parameters

  • req (Empty.Request) – an empty data structure

  • resp (Empty.Response) – an empty data structure representing response to the client

Returns

an empty data structure representing response to the client

Return type

Empty.Response

init_services()

loads ROS 2 services

load_urdf(path: str, pose: list[float], yaw: float, urdf_flags: int, fixed_base=False)

Loads a single URDF or XACRO robot

Parameters

  • path (str) – Path of the URDF or XACRO

  • pose (list[float]) – XYZ coordinates of the robot

  • yaw (float) – Yaw of the robot

  • urdf_flags (int) – flags for processing URDF data

  • fixed_base (bool, optional) – force the base of the loaded object to be static, defaults to False

Returns

int

Return type

a body unique id, a non-negative integer value

start_engine(gui=True)

Starts Pybullet physics engine

Parameters

gui (bool, optional) – determines if PyBullet starts with or without a GUI, defaults to True

Returns

a physics client id

Return type

int
